title: Job Chapter 36 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Job chapter 36 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Job Chapter 36 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Job Chapter 36.

questions.question: Who is speaking in Job chapter 36?
questions.correctAnswer: Elihu
questions.explanation: Job 36:1 states that Elihu proceeded to speak.

questions.question: According to Job 36:5, how is God described?
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty and despises none
questions.explanation: Verse 5 says God is mighty and does not despise any.

questions.question: What does God give to the poor as mentioned in Job 36:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Right
questions.explanation: Job 36:6 states God gives right to the poor.

questions.question: True or False: Job 36:7 says God withdraws His eyes from the righteous.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 7 says God does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous.

questions.question: What happens if people are bound in fetters and cords of affliction according to Job 36:8-9?
questions.correctAnswer: God shows them their transgressions
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 explain that God shows them their work and transgressions.

questions.question: According to Job 36:10, what does God open to discipline people?
questions.correctAnswer: Their ear
questions.explanation: Verse 10 says God opens their ear to discipline.

questions.question: According to Job 36:11, what will happen if they obey and serve God?
options: They will spend their days in prosperity
questions.correctAnswer: They will spend their days in prosperity
questions.explanation: Verse 11 states obedience leads to prosperity and pleasure.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Job 36:12: 'But if they obey not, they shall perish by the _____.'
questions.correctAnswer: sword
questions.explanation: Verse 12 says disobedience leads to perishing by the sword.

questions.question: Who heap up wrath in their heart according to Job 36:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Hypocrites
questions.explanation: Verse 13 identifies hypocrites in heart as heaping up wrath.

questions.question: What does God do for the poor in their affliction according to Job 36:15?
options: Delivers them and opens their ears
questions.correctAnswer: Delivers them and opens their ears
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states God delivers the poor and opens their ears in oppression.

questions.question: True or False: Job 36:19 says God esteems riches and gold above all.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 19 says God does not esteem riches, gold, nor strength.

questions.question: According to Job 36:22, by what is God exalted?
questions.correctAnswer: His power
questions.explanation: Verse 22 says God is exalted by His power.

questions.question: Who can say that God has wrought iniquity according to Job 36:23?
questions.correctAnswer: No one
questions.explanation: Verse 23 asks who can say God has wrought iniquity, implying no one can.

questions.question: True or False: Job 36:26 says the number of God's years can be searched out.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 26 says the number of God's years cannot be searched out.

questions.question: What does God make small according to Job 36:27?
questions.correctAnswer: The drops of water
questions.explanation: Verse 27 states God makes small the drops of water.

medium.title: Job Chapter 36 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Job Chapter 36 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Job 36, what biblical truth would you share about God's purpose in affliction?
options: God disciplines to reveal their transgressions and calls them to return from iniquity
God punishes without reason or hope of restoration
Affliction means God has abandoned them completely
Trials are always a sign of God's displeasure with no benefit
questions.correctAnswer: God disciplines to reveal their transgressions and calls them to return from iniquity
questions.explanation: Verses Job 36:8-10 teach that God allows affliction to open the ears of discipline and show people their transgressions so they may return from sin, emphasizing God's corrective and redemptive purpose.

questions.question: How does Job 36 teach us about trusting God's wisdom and power in difficult circumstances?
options: God is mighty in strength and wisdom and does not despise anyone
God is distant and unaware of human struggles
Human wisdom is superior to God's decisions
God only cares about the strong and powerful
questions.correctAnswer: God is mighty in strength and wisdom and does not despise anyone
questions.explanation: Job 36:5 states that God is mighty in strength and wisdom and does not despise any person, encouraging believers to trust in His sovereign power and wisdom in all situations.

questions.question: A believer asks how they can experience prosperity and pleasure in their days according to Job 36. What would be your biblical advice?
options: Ignore God's commands and follow your own desires
Seek wealth by any means necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Obey and serve God faithfully
questions.explanation: According to Job 36:11, those who obey and serve God will spend their days in prosperity and their years in pleasures, highlighting the blessing of obedience.

questions.question: How does Job 36 illustrate God's care for the poor and oppressed?
options: God delivers the poor in affliction and opens their ears in oppression
God ignores the poor and favors the rich
The poor must rely solely on themselves
Affliction is a punishment only for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: God delivers the poor in affliction and opens their ears in oppression
questions.explanation: Job 36:15 reveals that God delivers the poor in their affliction and opens their ears during oppression, showing His special care and justice for the vulnerable.

questions.question: According to Job 36, what warning is given about relying on riches for security?
options: Riches and strength cannot save a person from God's judgment
Riches guarantee God's favor and protection
Gold can buy forgiveness of sins
Strength and riches always protect from harm
questions.correctAnswer: Riches and strength cannot save a person from God's judgment
questions.explanation: Job 36:19 warns that God will not esteem riches, gold, or strength as a ransom, emphasizing that material wealth cannot deliver one from God's judgment.

questions.question: A Christian struggling with bitterness asks how to maintain a right heart. What does Job 36 suggest about the hypocrites and their fate?
options: Hypocrites heap up wrath and do not cry out when bound, leading to early death
Hypocrites are always forgiven without consequences
Hypocrisy is rewarded with long life
questions.correctAnswer: Hypocrites heap up wrath and do not cry out when bound, leading to early death
questions.explanation: Job 36:13-14 describes hypocrites as heaping up wrath and not crying out when afflicted, resulting in dying in youth among the unclean, highlighting the danger of a hard heart.

questions.question: How does Job 36 emphasize the importance of humility and contentment before God?
options: God’s greatness is beyond human understanding, and His works should be magnified
Humans can fully comprehend God's ways
Pride is the best way to approach God
Contentment is unnecessary if wealth increases
questions.correctAnswer: God’s greatness is beyond human understanding, and His works should be magnified
questions.explanation: Verses Job 36:24-26 encourage remembering and magnifying God's works because His greatness and years cannot be fully searched out, teaching humility and reverence.

questions.question: True or False: Job 36 teaches that God never withdraws His eyes from the righteous and establishes kings forever.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Job 36:7 states that God does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous and establishes kings forever, showing His ongoing care and support for those who follow Him.

questions.question: True or False: According to Job 36, desiring the night is encouraged because it brings rest and peace.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Job 36:20 instructs not to desire the night when people are cut off in their place, warning against longing for times associated with death and destruction.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and _______."
questions.correctAnswer: wisdom
questions.explanation: Job 36:5 clearly states that God is mighty in strength and wisdom, highlighting both His power and understanding.

questions.question: In the context of work ethic and integrity, what does Job 36 teach about obedience to God’s commands?
options: Obedience results in prosperity and pleasures in life
Obedience has no effect on daily life
Ignoring God’s commands leads to happiness
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience results in prosperity and pleasures in life
questions.explanation: Job 36:11 explains that those who obey and serve God will spend their days in prosperity and their years in pleasures, encouraging faithful service and integrity.

questions.question: How does Job 36 encourage believers to respond to discipline and correction?
options: By obeying and returning from iniquity
By rejecting it and becoming hardened
questions.correctAnswer: By obeying and returning from iniquity
questions.explanation: Job 36:10 teaches that God commands people to return from iniquity when He disciplines them, highlighting the call to repentance and humility.

questions.question: What lesson about generosity and stewardship can be drawn from Job 36’s description of God’s provision?
options: God gives meat in abundance and judges the people through the clouds
Only the rich receive God’s provision
questions.correctAnswer: God gives meat in abundance and judges the people through the clouds
questions.explanation: Job 36:31 explains that God provides food abundantly and judges people by the clouds, reminding believers of God’s generous provision and just governance.

questions.question: How does Job 36 encourage believers to maintain spiritual discipline through trials?
options: By recognizing God’s discipline as corrective and serving Him faithfully
By giving up and losing faith
By blaming God for their suffering
questions.correctAnswer: By recognizing God’s discipline as corrective and serving Him faithfully
questions.explanation: Verses Job 36:8-11 show that God’s discipline reveals sin and calls for obedience, promising prosperity to those who serve Him faithfully despite trials.

questions.question: What does Job 36 say about God's knowledge compared to human understanding?
options: God’s knowledge is perfect and beyond human search
Humans can fully understand all God’s ways
questions.correctAnswer: God’s knowledge is perfect and beyond human search
questions.explanation: Job 36:4 and 36:26 emphasize that God is perfect in knowledge and that His years or ways cannot be fully searched out by humans, encouraging humility in understanding.

hard.title: Job Chapter 36 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Job Chapter 36.

questions.question: In Job 36:5, how is God's nature described in relation to strength and wisdom?
options: God is mighty in strength and wisdom and does not despise any
God is merciful but weak in strength
God is indifferent to human affairs
questions.correctAnswer: God is mighty in strength and wisdom and does not despise any
questions.explanation: Job 36:5 states that God is mighty, despising no one, and is mighty in strength and wisdom, emphasizing His power and justice toward all.

questions.question: What role does God play according to Job 36:7 regarding the righteous and kings?
options: He withdraws His eyes from the righteous
He establishes kings on their thrones forever
He punishes kings but favors the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He establishes kings on their thrones forever
questions.explanation: Job 36:7 explains that God does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous and that He establishes kings on their thrones forever, highlighting divine endorsement of just leadership.

questions.question: According to Job 36:10, what does God do to those who are afflicted as part of discipline?
options: He opens their ear to discipline and commands return from iniquity
He grants them immediate relief without repentance
questions.correctAnswer: He opens their ear to discipline and commands return from iniquity
questions.explanation: Job 36:10 states that God opens the ears of the afflicted to discipline and commands them to return from their sin, indicating corrective purpose in suffering.

questions.question: What consequence does Job 36:12 associate with disobedience to God?
options: They shall perish by the sword and die without knowledge
They will prosper and live long
They will be exalted by men
They will be forgiven without penalty
questions.correctAnswer: They shall perish by the sword and die without knowledge
questions.explanation: Job 36:12 warns that disobedience leads to perishing by the sword and dying without knowledge, implying spiritual and physical ruin.

questions.question: What is the fate of hypocrites according to Job 36:13-14?
options: They heap up wrath and die in youth among the unclean
questions.correctAnswer: They heap up wrath and die in youth among the unclean
questions.explanation: Job 36:13-14 describes hypocrites as accumulating wrath without crying out when disciplined, resulting in dying young among the unclean, showing divine judgment on insincerity.

questions.question: How does Job 36:16 describe God's intended deliverance for the afflicted?
options: From a narrow place to a broad place with abundance on the table
questions.correctAnswer: From a narrow place to a broad place with abundance on the table
questions.explanation: Job 36:16 uses imagery of moving from 'the strait into a broad place' and having abundance on the table, symbolizing God's desire to relieve suffering and bless the righteous.

questions.question: In Job 36:18, what warning is given about God's wrath?
options: Beware lest He take you away with His stroke, and no great ransom can deliver you
Wrath is only for the wicked king
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest He take you away with His stroke, and no great ransom can deliver you
questions.explanation: Job 36:18 warns that God's wrath is severe and final, such that no ransom can save one from His judgment, emphasizing the seriousness of divine discipline.

questions.question: What does Job 36:19 say about riches in the face of God's judgment?
options: Riches, gold, and strength have no value before God
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, gold, and strength have no value before God
questions.explanation: According to Job 36:19, God does not esteem riches or strength, indicating that material wealth cannot protect one from divine judgment or replace righteousness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Job 36:21: 'Take heed, regard not ______: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.'
questions.correctAnswer: iniquity
questions.explanation: Job 36:21 urges not to regard iniquity, which the person has chosen over affliction, highlighting the moral choice involved in suffering and sin.

questions.question: According to Job 36:22, what unique attribute of God is emphasized?
options: God exalteth by His power and none teaches like Him
God is subject to human teaching
questions.correctAnswer: God exalteth by His power and none teaches like Him
questions.explanation: Job 36:22 emphasizes God's unique power to exalt and His unparalleled role as teacher, underscoring His sovereign authority and wisdom.

questions.question: What rhetorical question in Job 36:23 challenges the notion of God committing iniquity?
options: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
Who can stand before the Lord?
Is God just in all His ways?
questions.correctAnswer: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
questions.explanation: Job 36:23 uses a rhetorical question to assert that no one can accuse God of wrongdoing or dictate His actions, affirming divine justice and sovereignty.

questions.question: How is God's work described in Job 36:24-25 in terms of human perception?
options: Men behold and see God's work even from afar
God’s work is hidden and unknowable
God’s work is revealed only in dreams
questions.correctAnswer: Men behold and see God's work even from afar
questions.explanation: Job 36:24-25 states that men can see and behold God's work from afar, highlighting the visible evidence of God's power in creation.

questions.question: What does Job 36:26 reveal about the comprehensibility of God?
options: God is great and beyond human knowledge; His years cannot be searched out
God is fully known and measured by men
God’s age is written in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: God is great and beyond human knowledge; His years cannot be searched out
questions.explanation: Job 36:26 declares God's greatness and the impossibility of fully understanding His eternal nature, emphasizing divine transcendence.

questions.question: True or False: Job 36:27-28 describes God’s control over natural phenomena such as rain and clouds.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 27 and 28 describe God making the drops of water and causing rain to pour down from clouds, showing His sovereignty over nature.

questions.question: What does Job 36:31-32 say about God's use of clouds and light?
options: God judges people by clouds and commands light to be covered
Clouds are meaningless in God's plans
questions.correctAnswer: God judges people by clouds and commands light to be covered
questions.explanation: Job 36:31-32 explains that God uses clouds to judge people and can command the light not to shine when clouds come between, symbolizing divine control over nature and justice.

theological.title: Job Chapter 36 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Job Chapter 36 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Job 36, what is attributed to God by Elihu as he begins his speech?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness to his Maker
questions.explanation: Elihu states in Job 36:3 that he will ascribe righteousness to his Maker, affirming God's just nature. This aligns with Psalm 145:17, Romans 3:26, Isaiah 45:21, and 1 John 1:9, all emphasizing God's righteousness and justice.

questions.question: What does Job 36:5 say about God's attitude towards people?
options: God is mighty and despiseth not any
God favors the wealthy over the poor
questions.correctAnswer: God is mighty and despiseth not any
questions.explanation: Job 36:5 declares God's might and impartiality—He does not despise any person. This reflects God's universal love and justice seen in James 2:1, Acts 10:34, Romans 2:11, and Psalm 145:9.

questions.question: According to Job 36:6, whom does God not preserve and whom does He give right to?
options: He does not preserve the wicked but gives right to the poor
He does not preserve the poor but gives right to the wicked
He preserves both the wicked and the poor equally
questions.correctAnswer: He does not preserve the wicked but gives right to the poor
questions.explanation: Job 36:6 teaches that God does not preserve the wicked but defends the poor, demonstrating His justice and care for the marginalized, consistent with Proverbs 29:7, Psalm 140:12, Isaiah 1:17, and Luke 1:52.

questions.question: What happens to those who are bound in affliction according to Job 36:8-10?
options: God shows them their transgressions and commands them to return from iniquity
They are immediately delivered without any discipline
questions.correctAnswer: God shows them their transgressions and commands them to return from iniquity
questions.explanation: Verses 8-10 explain that affliction serves as discipline whereby God reveals sins and calls for repentance, consistent with Hebrews 12:6, Proverbs 3:11-12, Psalm 94:12, and Revelation 3:19.

questions.question: What is the promised outcome if those disciplined by God obey and serve Him, according to Job 36:11?
options: They shall spend their days in prosperity and their years in pleasures
They will be forgotten by God
They will still perish by the sword
questions.correctAnswer: They shall spend their days in prosperity and their years in pleasures
questions.explanation: Job 36:11 promises blessing and prosperity for obedience, reflecting God's covenantal blessings as seen in Deuteronomy 28:1-14, Psalm 1:3, Proverbs 10:22, and John 10:10.

questions.question: According to Job 36:12, what is the fate of those who do not obey God?
options: They shall perish by the sword and die without knowledge
They will be forgiven and restored
They will receive mercy without repentance
questions.correctAnswer: They shall perish by the sword and die without knowledge
questions.explanation: Job 36:12 warns of destruction and ignorance for disobedience, consistent with Romans 6:23, Proverbs 1:24-27, Hebrews 10:26-27, and Matthew 7:13-14.

questions.question: What characterizes the hypocrites in heart as described in Job 36:13-14?
options: They heap up wrath and die in youth among the unclean
They cry out when bound by God
questions.correctAnswer: They heap up wrath and die in youth among the unclean
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 describe hypocrites who resist discipline, resulting in premature death and impurity, paralleling Proverbs 21:27, Jeremiah 17:9, Matthew 23:27-28, and Romans 1:18-32.

questions.question: How does God respond to the poor in affliction according to Job 36:15?
options: He delivers them and opens their ears in oppression
He punishes them for their sins
He sends them further into suffering
questions.correctAnswer: He delivers them and opens their ears in oppression
questions.explanation: Job 36:15 emphasizes God's deliverance and instruction to the oppressed, consistent with Psalm 9:9, Isaiah 61:1, Luke 4:18, and James 2:5.

questions.question: What warning is given in Job 36:18 regarding God's wrath?
options: Beware lest he take thee away with his stroke; then a great ransom cannot deliver thee
God's wrath can always be appeased by wealth
Wrath is only for the wicked, not for the righteous
God's wrath is temporary and easily avoided
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest he take thee away with his stroke; then a great ransom cannot deliver thee
questions.explanation: Job 36:18 warns that God's judgment is final and cannot be averted by any ransom, echoed in Psalm 49:7-8, Proverbs 6:35, Hebrews 10:26-31, and Revelation 20:14-15.

questions.question: According to Job 36:19, will God esteem riches or strength in the day of judgment?
options: No, neither gold nor all the forces of strength
Yes, riches will save the person
Both riches and strength guarantee favor
questions.correctAnswer: No, neither gold nor all the forces of strength
questions.explanation: Verse 19 declares that material wealth and strength cannot secure God's favor at judgment, aligning with 1 Timothy 6:9-10, Ecclesiastes 5:10, Matthew 6:19-21, and Luke 12:15.

questions.question: What does Job 36:21 advise regarding iniquity and affliction?
options: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction
Affliction is always worse than sin
Iniquity is preferable to God's discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction
questions.explanation: Job 36:21 urges choosing God's discipline over sin, consistent with Hebrews 12:5-11, Proverbs 3:11-12, Psalm 94:12, and Revelation 3:19.

questions.question: What question is posed in Job 36:23 to emphasize God's righteousness and justice?
options: "Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?"
"Who can see the end of all things?"
questions.correctAnswer: "Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?"
questions.explanation: Job 36:23 challenges human authority over God’s ways and denies any charge of iniquity against Him, consistent with Isaiah 55:8-9, Romans 9:20-21, Psalm 89:14, and Job 1:21.

questions.question: How does Job 36:26 describe God's greatness and our knowledge of Him?
options: God is great, and we know Him not, neither can the number of His years be searched out
God is small and easily understood
God reveals all His mysteries to man
questions.correctAnswer: God is great, and we know Him not, neither can the number of His years be searched out
questions.explanation: This verse asserts God's incomprehensible greatness and eternal nature, aligning with Isaiah 40:28, Psalm 147:5, Romans 11:33, and Job 37:23.

questions.question: What natural phenomenon does Job 36:27-28 describe as a demonstration of God's power and providence?
options: The making of small drops of water and abundant rain from clouds
The rising and setting of the sun
The growth of plants and trees
questions.correctAnswer: The making of small drops of water and abundant rain from clouds
questions.explanation: These verses highlight God's control over rain, symbolizing His sustaining power, consistent with Psalm 135:7, Jeremiah 10:13, Matthew 5:45, and James 5:7.

questions.question: What does Job 36:31 say about the clouds and their purpose?
options: By them God judges the people and gives meat in abundance
They are merely for decoration in the sky
questions.correctAnswer: By them God judges the people and gives meat in abundance
questions.explanation: Verse 31 indicates that clouds serve God's judgment and provision, paralleling Psalm 78:23-24, Ezekiel 34:26, Joel 2:23, and Matthew 16:2-3.
